ARABIC: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: except for him who snatches a snippet and then is pursued by a piercing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Except those who eavesdrop and are pursued by a shooting flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Some of them who stealthily steal words from the heavens are pursued by a glistening flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Except one who sometimes steals a part, so a blazing flame goes after him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Except such as snatch away something by stealing, and they are pursued by a flaming fire of piercing brightness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Except him who snatches off but once, then there follows him a brightly shining flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: except such as snatches a fragment, and he is pursued by a piercing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Save him who snatcheth a fragment, and there pursueth him a piercing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But if anyone does succeed in snatching a glimpse [of such knowledge], he shall be pursued by a piercing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Except him who snatcheth away a word by stealth, and him then pursueth a glowing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: except any who snatches a snatch, whereat a piercing flame pursues him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Except such as snatch away something by stealth, and they are pursued by a flaming fire, of piercing brightness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Except such as snatch away something by stealing and they are pursued by a flaming fire of piercing brightness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: except such as snatches a fragment, and he is pursued by a piercing flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Except for him who snatches a fragment—he gets pursued by a piercing projectile.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:10] except him who snatches a fragment (al-khatfa is the verbal noun, that is to say, ‘[that] one time’; the exceptive clause refers to the subject [of the verb] yasma‘ūna, in other words, ‘the only devil that is able to   listen is the one that hears a word from the angels and snatches it away quickly’) and who is then pursued by a piercing flame (shihāb is a meteor) that pierces him, or burns him or robs him of his senses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Save him who snatcheth a fragment) save him who snatches a little of the words of the angels, (and there pursueth him a piercing flame) and is chased by a bright star which burns him.
